lead_paragraph: The Obama administration tightened eligibility for those who miss the Affordable Care Act enrollment deadline; insurers have complained that many consumers applied belatedly only when they became ill.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Toughens Rules for Latecomers Trying to Enroll Under Health Act
headline.main: U.S. Toughens Rules for Latecomers Trying to Enroll in Health Care Act

snippet: The Obama administration tightened eligibility for those who miss the Affordable Care Act enrollment deadline; insurers have complained that many consumers applied belatedly only when they became ill.
abstract: Federal insurance marketplace chief executive Kevin J Counihan announces several rules that will make it more difficult for consumers to get health insurance after open enrollment period; move is in response to complaints from insurers that many consumers only apply when they get sick.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
